text: Nana Gualdi (April 29, 1932, Basel, Switzerland – July 11, 2007) was a German singer and actress. Gualdi, born as Adriana Klein, had a hit with the German version of the song, "Everybody Loves a Lover", which was popularized in the United States by Doris Day. She appeared in several films including '. During the 1980s, Ms. Gualdi enjoyed success as a stage actress in Hamburg and Stuttgart, Germany. Nana Gualdi died at age 75 in 2007 of undisclosed causes. ==External links== *IMDb/bio *Transwiki (German language) Category:German film actresses Category:German stage actresses Category:German female singers Category:1932 births Category:2007 deaths Category:Place of death missing Category:20th-century German actresses Category:People from Basel-Stadt Category:20th-century German singers Category:20th-century women singers
title: Nana Gualdi
